top_ideas.description: A non-material abstract realm contains perfect, immutable archetypes (Forms) of which objects in our world are imperfect copies.
Illustrates how most people live in ignorance, mistaking sensory shadows for reality, and describes the philosopher’s ascent to true knowledge.
The human soul has three parts—reason, spirit, and appetite—which must be balanced for justice within the individual.
Ideal ruler is a philosopher who understands the Forms and governs the polis with wisdom and justice.
Justice consists in each part of society (and soul) doing its proper work in harmony, mirrored in the class structure of the ideal city.
Learning is recollection of innate knowledge from the soul’s previous existence in the world of Forms.
Love (Eros) is a ladder of ascent from physical attraction to the beauty of minds and ultimately to the Form of Beauty itself.
A metaphor dividing reality into the visible (opinion) and intelligible (knowledge), illustrating levels of understanding from illusion to true insight.
The first institution of higher learning in Western history, dedicated to philosophical inquiry and the pursuit of truth.
Account of the universe as a living creature with a soul, structured by mathematical and metaphysical principles.
